TextView.android:text: Cars are recycled in four steps: dismantling, crushing, shredding, and resource recovery. In the dismantling stage, processors recover the fluids and take apart the usable parts and components. These include batteries, wheels and tires, steering columns, fenders, radios, engines, starters, transmissions, alternators, select plastic parts and components, glass, foams, catalytic convertors, and other components, based on aftermarket demand. The processor then crushes the vehicle and loads it onto the vehicle shredder. After separation, the recovered metals are remelted at the mills, and the ASR is landfilled.For recycling automotives please approach near shredder point.
